page.title: 19Changes within living memory
page.content: Today there are fewer shops, although we do have a small supermarket, schools for infants and juniors only, a small new industrial estate and many more houses. The children still seem to play similar outdoor games to their grandparents and also to play in the same woods and fields as their parents. Fifty years ago indoor entertainment was supplied by the radio or the gramophone but nowadays we have television and videos. Chilton can still provide many of its own needs having a Health Centre, pubs, clubs and opportunity for a variety of recreational activities at the newly developed Community College, but old sights such as the coal being dumped on the back street to be shovelled into the coalhouse have gone for ever.
